meanings.definition: A person or thing that encloses or surrounds something.
meanings.sent1: The encloser of the garden was a tall wooden fence.
meanings.sent2: The box was the perfect encloser for the precious jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the encloser of the tree trunk as a hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an invisible encloser, wrapping everyone in warmth.
meanings.sent5: The encloser of the maze made it impossible to find the way out.

meanings.definition: A structure or device that encloses or contains something.
meanings.sent1: The refrigerator acted as the encloser for the fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The encloser for the documents was a sturdy metal cabinet.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten turned the shoebox into an encloser for its toys.
meanings.sent4: The fog was an encloser, hiding the city in a mysterious veil.
meanings.sent5: The encloser of the safe kept the valuable items secure.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing or surrounding something.
meanings.sent1: The encloser of the garden with a fence was necessary to keep out pests.
meanings.sent2: The encloser of the letter with a seal ensured its confidentiality.
meanings.sent3: The encloser of the cake with a dome kept it fresh for the party.
meanings.sent4: The encloser of silence in the library was broken by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent5: The encloser of the park with trees created a peaceful oasis in the city.
